page.title: 09The Old Water Mill
page.content:
This old water mill is sited where {Dalton Gill}joins{Dalton Beck.}Local corn was ground here until about 1925. The large wooden wheel was removed from the east side of the building some 30 years ago but its position can still be traced. Barter used to be the main means of exchange operating at the time, a half day's threshing labour or some grain, eggs etc. in return for a quantity of ground flour.
Millstones were obtained locally possibly from a small quarry by the side of Dalton Beck. There is also a small field known as{Grindstone Garth, where if one looks closely, one can see the remains of old stone archways which formed parts of the{old brewery buildings.
